qas.question: Around how many Hotels does Guam currently have?
How many public golf courses does Guam currently have?
About how many tourist visit Guam yearly?
Which major U.S store does Guam currently have that happens to be the largest in the world?
HOw many stores are there in the Duty Free Shoppers Galleria?
After Japan where do most tourists to Guam come from?
How many retail stores are there in Agana Shopping Center?
Where do most tourists to the Philippines come from?
From where do most tourists come from in Taiwan?

context: Lying in the western Pacific, Guam is a popular destination for <a0_0>Japanese<a0_0/> tourists. Its tourist hub, Tumon, features over <a1_0><b5_0><b7_0>20<b7_0/><b5_0/> large hotels<a1_0/>, a Duty Free Shoppers Galleria, Pleasure Island district, indoor aquarium, Sandcastle Las Vegas–styled shows and other shopping and entertainment venues. It is a relatively short flight from Asia or Australia compared to Hawaii, with hotels and <a2_0>seven<a2_0/> public golf courses accommodating over <a3_0>a million<a3_0/> tourists per year. Although 75% of the tourists are Japanese, Guam receives a sizable number of tourists from <b9_0>South Korea<b9_0/>, <b8_0>the U.S.<b8_0/>, the Philippines, and <b6_0>Taiwan<b6_0/>. Significant sources of revenue include duty-free designer shopping outlets, and the American-style malls: Micronesia Mall, Guam Premier Outlets, the Agana Shopping Center, and the world's largest <a4_0>Kmart<a4_0/>.[citation needed]
